description: Step-by-step verification test diagrams for TypeScript/Swift Mermaid implementation comparison

diagrams.name: Simple Flow
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  A[Start] --> B[Process] --> C[End]

diagrams.name: Original Node Shapes
diagrams.source:
graph LR
  A[Rectangle] --> B(Rounded)
  B --> C{Diamond}
  C --> D([Stadium])
  D --> E((Circle))

diagrams.name: Batch 1 Shapes
Batch 2 Shapes
diagrams.source:
graph LR
  A[(Database)] --> B>Flag Shape]
  B --> C[/Wider Bottom\]
  C --> D[\Wider Top/]

diagrams.name: All 12 Flowchart Shapes
diagrams.source:
graph LR
  A[Rectangle] --> B(Rounded)
  B --> C{Diamond}
  C --> D([Stadium])
  D --> E((Circle))
  E --> F[[Subroutine]]
  F --> G(((Double Circle)))
  G --> H{{Hexagon}}
  H --> I[(Database)]
  I --> J>Flag]
  J --> K[/Trapezoid\]
  K --> L[\Inverse Trap/]

diagrams.name: All Edge Styles
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  A[Source] -->|solid| B[Target 1]
  A -.->|dotted| C[Target 2]
  A ==>|thick| D[Target 3]

diagrams.name: No-Arrow Edges
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  A[Node 1] ---|related| B[Node 2]
  B -.- C[Node 3]
  C === D[Node 4]

diagrams.name: Bidirectional Arrows
diagrams.source:
graph LR
  A[Client] <-->|sync| B[Server]
  B <-.->|heartbeat| C[Monitor]
  C <==>|data| D[Storage]

diagrams.name: Parallel Links (&)
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  A[Input] & B[Config] --> C[Processor]
  C --> D[Output] & E[Log]

diagrams.name: Chained Edges
diagrams.source:
graph LR
  A[Step 1] --> B[Step 2] --> C[Step 3] --> D[Step 4] --> E[Step 5]

diagrams.name: Direction: Left-Right
diagrams.source:
graph LR
  A[Input] --> B[Transform] --> C[Output]

diagrams.name: Direction: Bottom-Top
diagrams.source:
graph BT
  A[Foundation] --> B[Layer 2] --> C[Top]

diagrams.name: Subgraphs
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  subgraph Frontend
    A[React App] --> B[State Manager]
  end
  subgraph Backend
    C[API Server] --> D[Database]
  end
  B --> C

diagrams.name: Nested Subgraphs
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  subgraph Cloud
    subgraph us-east [US East Region]
      A[Web Server] --> B[App Server]
    end
    subgraph us-west [US West Region]
      C[Web Server] --> D[App Server]
    end
  end
  E[Load Balancer] --> A
  E --> C

diagrams.name: Subgraph Direction Override
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  subgraph pipeline [Processing Pipeline]
    direction LR
    A[Input] --> B[Parse] --> C[Transform] --> D[Output]
  end
  E[Source] --> A
  D --> F[Sink]

diagrams.name: Class Shorthand (:::)
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  A[Normal]:::default --> B[Highlighted]:::highlight --> C[Error]:::error
  classDef default fill:#f4f4f5,stroke:#a1a1aa
  classDef highlight fill:#fbbf24,stroke:#d97706
  classDef error fill:#ef4444,stroke:#dc2626

diagrams.name: Inline Style Overrides
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  A[Default] --> B[Custom Colors] --> C[Another Custom]
  style B fill:#3b82f6,stroke:#1d4ed8,color:#ffffff
  style C fill:#10b981,stroke:#059669

diagrams.name: CI/CD Pipeline
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  subgraph ci [CI Pipeline]
    A[Push Code] --> B{Tests Pass?}
    B -->|Yes| C[Build Image]
    B -->|No| D[Fix & Retry]
    D -.-> A
  end
  C --> E([Deploy Staging])
  E --> F{QA Approved?}
  F -->|Yes| G((Production))
  F -->|No| D

diagrams.name: System Architecture
diagrams.source:
graph LR
  subgraph clients [Client Layer]
    A([Web App]) --> B[API Gateway]
    C([Mobile App]) --> B
  end
  subgraph services [Service Layer]
    B --> D[Auth Service]
    B --> E[User Service]
    B --> F[Order Service]
  end
  subgraph data [Data Layer]
    D --> G[(Auth DB)]
    E --> H[(User DB)]
    F --> I[(Order DB)]
    F --> J([Message Queue])
  end

diagrams.name: System Architecture (Services First)
diagrams.source:
graph LR
  subgraph services [Service Layer]
    B[API Gateway] --> D[Auth Service]
    B --> E[User Service]
    B --> F[Order Service]
  end
  subgraph clients [Client Layer]
    A([Web App]) --> B
    C([Mobile App]) --> B
  end
  subgraph data [Data Layer]
    D --> G[(Auth DB)]
    E --> H[(User DB)]
    F --> I[(Order DB)]
    F --> J([Message Queue])
  end

diagrams.name: Decision Tree
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  A{Is it raining?} -->|Yes| B{Have umbrella?}
  A -->|No| C([Go outside])
  B -->|Yes| D([Go with umbrella])
  B -->|No| E{Is it heavy?}
  E -->|Yes| F([Stay inside])
  E -->|No| G([Run for it])

diagrams.name: Git Branching Workflow
diagrams.source:
graph LR
  A[main] --> B[develop]
  B --> C[feature/auth]
  B --> D[feature/ui]
  C --> E{PR Review}
  D --> E
  E -->|approved| B
  B --> F[release/1.0]
  F --> G{Tests?}
  G -->|pass| A
  G -->|fail| F

diagrams.name: Self-Loop Edge
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  A[Retry Node] --> A

diagrams.name: Self-Loop with Label
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  A[Process] -->|retry| A
  A --> B[Done]

diagrams.name: Multiple Self-Loops
diagrams.source:
graph TD
  A[Start] --> B[Validate]
  B -->|invalid| B
  B -->|valid| C[Process]
  C -->|retry| C
  C --> D[End]

diagrams.name: Basic State Diagram
diagrams.source:
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Idle
  Idle --> Active : start
  Active --> Idle : cancel
  Active --> Done : complete
  Done --> [*]

diagrams.name: Composite States
diagrams.source:
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Idle
  Idle --> Processing : submit
  state Processing {
    parse --> validate
    validate --> execute
  }
  Processing --> Complete : done
  Processing --> Error : fail
  Error --> Idle : retry
  Complete --> [*]

diagrams.name: Connection Lifecycle
diagrams.source:
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Closed
  Closed --> Connecting : connect
  Connecting --> Connected : success
  Connecting --> Closed : timeout
  Connected --> Disconnecting : close
  Connected --> Reconnecting : error
  Reconnecting --> Connected : success
  Reconnecting --> Closed : max_retries
  Disconnecting --> Closed : done
  Closed --> [*]

diagrams.name: Basic Messages
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  Alice->>Bob: Hello Bob!
  Bob-->>Alice: Hi Alice!

diagrams.name: Participant Aliases
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  participant A as Alice
  participant B as Bob
  participant C as Charlie
  A->>B: Hello
  B->>C: Forward
  C-->>A: Reply

diagrams.name: Actor Stick Figures
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  actor U as User
  participant S as System
  participant DB as Database
  U->>S: Click button
  S->>DB: Query
  DB-->>S: Results
  S-->>U: Display

diagrams.name: Arrow Types
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  A->>B: Solid arrow (sync)
  B-->>A: Dashed arrow (return)
  A-)B: Open arrow (async)
  B--)A: Open dashed arrow

diagrams.name: Activation Boxes
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  participant C as Client
  participant S as Server
  C->>+S: Request
  S->>+S: Process
  S->>-S: Done
  S-->>-C: Response

diagrams.name: Self-Messages
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  participant S as Server
  S->>S: Internal process
  S->>S: Validate
  S-->>S: Log

diagrams.name: Loop Block
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  participant C as Client
  participant S as Server
  C->>S: Connect
  loop Every 30s
    C->>S: Heartbeat
    S-->>C: Ack
  end
  C->>S: Disconnect

diagrams.name: Alt/Else Block
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  participant C as Client
  participant S as Server
  C->>S: Login
  alt Valid credentials
    S-->>C: 200 OK
  else Invalid
    S-->>C: 401 Unauthorized
  else Account locked
    S-->>C: 403 Forbidden
  end

diagrams.name: Opt Block
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  participant A as App
  participant C as Cache
  participant DB as Database
  A->>C: Get data
  C-->>A: Cache miss
  opt Cache miss
    A->>DB: Query
    DB-->>A: Results
    A->>C: Store in cache
  end

diagrams.name: Par Block
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  participant C as Client
  participant A as AuthService
  participant U as UserService
  participant O as OrderService
  C->>A: Authenticate
  par Fetch user data
    A->>U: Get profile
  and Fetch orders
    A->>O: Get orders
  end
  A-->>C: Combined response

diagrams.name: Critical Block
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  participant A as App
  participant DB as Database
  A->>DB: BEGIN
  critical Transaction
    A->>DB: UPDATE accounts
    A->>DB: INSERT log
  end
  A->>DB: COMMIT

diagrams.name: Notes (Right/Left/Over)
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  participant A as Alice
  participant B as Bob
  Note left of A: Alice prepares
  A->>B: Hello
  Note right of B: Bob thinks
  B-->>A: Reply
  Note over A,B: Conversation complete

diagrams.name: OAuth 2.0 Flow
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  actor U as User
  participant App as Client App
  participant Auth as Auth Server
  participant API as Resource API
  U->>App: Click Login
  App->>Auth: Authorization request
  Auth->>U: Login page
  U->>Auth: Credentials
  Auth-->>App: Authorization code
  App->>Auth: Exchange code for token
  Auth-->>App: Access token
  App->>API: Request + token
  API-->>App: Protected resource
  App-->>U: Display data

diagrams.name: Database Transaction
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  participant C as Client
  participant S as Server
  participant DB as Database
  C->>S: POST /transfer
  S->>DB: BEGIN
  S->>DB: Debit account A
  alt Success
    S->>DB: Credit account B
    S->>DB: INSERT audit_log
    S->>DB: COMMIT
    S-->>C: 200 OK
  else Insufficient funds
    S->>DB: ROLLBACK
    S-->>C: 400 Bad Request
  end

diagrams.name: Microservice Orchestration
diagrams.source:
sequenceDiagram
  participant G as Gateway
  participant A as Auth
  participant U as Users
  participant O as Orders
  participant N as Notify
  G->>A: Validate token
  A-->>G: Valid
  par Fetch data
    G->>U: Get user
    U-->>G: User data
  and
    G->>O: Get orders
    O-->>G: Order list
  end
  G->>N: Send notification
  N-->>G: Queued
  Note over G: Aggregate response

diagrams.name: Basic Class
diagrams.source:
classDiagram
  class Animal {
    +String name
    +int age
    +eat() void
    +sleep() void
  }

diagrams.name: Visibility Markers
diagrams.source:
classDiagram
  class User {
    +String name
    -String password
    #int internalId
    ~String packageField
    +login() bool
    -hashPassword() String
    #validate() void
    ~notify() void
  }

diagrams.name: Interface Annotation
Abstract Annotation
diagrams.source:
classDiagram
  class Shape {
    <<abstract>>
    +String color
    +area() double
    +draw() void
  }

diagrams.name: Enum Annotation
diagrams.source:
classDiagram
  class Status {
    <<enumeration>>
    ACTIVE
    INACTIVE
    PENDING
    DELETED
  }

diagrams.name: Inheritance (<|--)
Composition (*--)
Aggregation (o--)
Association (-->)
Dependency (..>)
Realization (..|>)
All 6 Relationship Types
diagrams.source:
classDiagram
  A <|-- B : inheritance
  C *-- D : composition
  E o-- F : aggregation
  G --> H : association
  I ..> J : dependency
  K ..|> L : realization

diagrams.name: Relationship Labels
Design Pattern - Observer
MVC Architecture
diagrams.source:
classDiagram
  class Model {
    -data Map
    +getData() Map
    +setData(key, val) void
    +notify() void
  }
  class View {
    -model Model
    +render() void
    +update() void
  }
  class Controller {
    -model Model
    -view View
    +handleInput(event) void
    +updateModel(data) void
  }
  Controller --> Model : updates
  Controller --> View : refreshes
  View --> Model : reads
  Model ..> View : notifies

diagrams.name: Full Hierarchy
Basic Relationship
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  CUSTOMER ||--o{ ORDER : places

diagrams.name: Entity with Attributes
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  CUSTOMER {
    int id PK
    string name
    string email UK
    date created_at
  }

diagrams.name: Attribute Keys (PK, FK, UK)
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  ORDER {
    int id PK
    int customer_id FK
    string invoice_number UK
    decimal total
    date order_date
    string status
  }

diagrams.name: Exactly One to Exactly One
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  PERSON ||--|| PASSPORT : has

diagrams.name: Exactly One to Zero-or-Many
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  CUSTOMER ||--o{ ORDER : places

diagrams.name: Zero-or-One to One-or-Many
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  SUPERVISOR |o--|{ EMPLOYEE : manages

diagrams.name: One-or-More to Zero-or-Many
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  TEACHER }|--o{ COURSE : teaches

diagrams.name: All Cardinality Types
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  A ||--|| B : one-to-one
  C ||--o{ D : one-to-many
  E |o--|{ F : opt-to-many
  G }|--o{ H : many-to-many

diagrams.name: Identifying Relationship
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  ORDER ||--|{ LINE_ITEM : contains

diagrams.name: Non-Identifying Relationship
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  USER ||..o{ LOG_ENTRY : generates
  USER ||..o{ SESSION : opens

diagrams.name: Mixed Identifying & Non-Identifying
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  ORDER ||--|{ LINE_ITEM : contains
  ORDER ||..o{ SHIPMENT : ships-via
  PRODUCT ||--o{ LINE_ITEM : includes
  PRODUCT ||..o{ REVIEW : receives

diagrams.name: E-Commerce Schema
Blog Platform Schema
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  USER {
    int id PK
    string username UK
    string email UK
    date joined
  }
  POST {
    int id PK
    string title
    text content
    int author_id FK
    date published
  }
  COMMENT {
    int id PK
    text body
    int post_id FK
    int user_id FK
    date created
  }
  TAG {
    int id PK
    string name UK
  }
  USER ||--o{ POST : writes
  USER ||--o{ COMMENT : authors
  POST ||--o{ COMMENT : has
  POST }|--o{ TAG : tagged-with

diagrams.name: School Management Schema
diagrams.source:
erDiagram
  STUDENT {
    int id PK
    string name
    date dob
    string grade
  }
  TEACHER {
    int id PK
    string name
    string department
  }
  COURSE {
    int id PK
    string title
    int teacher_id FK
    int credits
  }
  ENROLLMENT {
    int id PK
    int student_id FK
    int course_id FK
    string semester
    float grade
  }
  TEACHER ||--o{ COURSE : teaches
  STUDENT ||--o{ ENROLLMENT : enrolled
  COURSE ||--o{ ENROLLMENT : has
